instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO: What is PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO? PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO is a power rail .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: im kinda confused on this issue. Is the audio chip located on the small board together with the mag safe? I've checked <CHIP>U8040</CHIP> has enable signal on out i also have <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO</SIGNAL> also <CHIP>U6410</CHIP> gets 5v but nothing on output also <SIGNAL>MAX98300_R_P</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>MAX98300_R_N</SIGNAL> are missing or they suppose to miss not sure. Any ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: All audio is on the IO board besides the right speaker amp. Try known good IO board and cable first and check J9500 of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: I have 3 good IO boards. I can't figure it out what i'm missing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: I've noticed that after i put the second good IO board i got chime when it was turning on but after there wasn't sound. Also after replacing the io board my fan run on highest RPM  I've replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR> and i checked <RESISTOR>R6061</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: Did you replace the cable and check J9500?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: I've checked the J9500 is fine only thing i haven't try is different cable 821-<SIGNAL>1722_A</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: I've lost power also for some reason green light stays for 50 seconds and after goes away
